History: Chartered ship, 32/35 crew, 450 tons. Principal Managing Owner: William Bawtree. Voyages: (1) 1818/9 Bengal. Capt Lucas Percival. Downs 27 May 1819 - 30 Sep Bengal - 29 Dec Narsipur - 3 Jan 1820 Madras - 22 Mar St Helena - 13 May East India Dock. (2) 1822/3 Bengal. Capt Lucas Percival. Downs 25 May 1829 - 21 Sep Hugli - 14 Oct Calcutta - 29 Jan 1824 Saugor - 2 Apr St Helena - 17 Jun East India Dock. (3) 1825/6 Madras and Bengal. Capt Lucas Percival. Downs 23 May 1826 - 17 Sep Madras - 25 Oct Calcutta - 18 Jan 1827 Madras - 7 Apr St Helena - 1 Jun Blackwall. (4) 1827/8 Bengal. Capt Lucas Percival. Downs 23 Jun 1828 - 14 Sep Cape - 1 Dec Bengal - 15 Jun 1829 St Helena - 17 Aug East India Dock.

Built by Wigram, launched 1825, 3 decks, 4in bottom, length 165ft 10in, keel 133ft 4in, breadth 43ft 3¾ in, hold 17ft 2in, wing transom 26ft, port cell 29ft 8in, waist 1ft 4in, between decks 6ft 8in & 6ft 4in, roundhouse 6ft 3½in, ports 14 middle & 13 upper, deck range 97ft 6in, 149/174 crew, 1331 tons. Principal Managing Owners: 1-3 Henry Bonham, 4 John Innes. Sold to Palmers McKillop & Co 9 Oct 1834, £8000. Voyages: (1) 1825/6 Bombay and China. Capt John Innes. Downs 13 Jan 1826 - 3 May Bombay - 15 Jul Singapore - 31 Jul Whampoa - 25 Jan 1827 St Helena - 16 Mar Blackwall. (2) 1827/8 Bombay and China. Capt John Innes. Downs 21 Feb 1828 - 5 Jun Bombay - 3 Sep Malacca - 26 Sep Whampoa - 12 Dec Macao - 22 Feb 1829 St Helena - 20 Apr Blackwall. (3) 1829/30 Bombay and China. Capt John Innes. Downs 22 Jan 1830 - 15 May Bombay - 2 Sep Kowloon - 19 Sep Whampoa - 27 Jan 1831 Cape - 19 Feb St Helena - 12 Apr Blackwall. (4) 18312 Bombay and China. Capt John Innes. Portsmouth 20 Mar 1832 - 19 Jun Bombay - 22 Sep Whampoa - Second Bar 27 Oct - 13 Apr 1833 Blackwall.
Voyages: (1) From Bengal 1796. Capt John Gilmore. Kedgeree 1 Feb 1796 - 23 Apr St Helena - 21 Jun Falmouth - 18 Jul Blackwall.

Built 1622, 200/300 tons. Voyages: (1) 1621/2 Java and Sumatra. Downs Jul 1622 - 17 Dec Cape - Batavia - Tiku - Dec 1623 Batavia - voyages to Sumatra 1624, Lagundy 1625, Coromandel 1626-27, Sumatra 1628 & 1629 - laid up 1631, rotten.

400 tons, 30 guns, 80 crew. Voyages: (1) 1702/3 Surat. Capt John Goodfellow. Downs 11 Jun 1703 - 11 Oct 'Sandy Bay' Guinea - 24 Nov Cape - 18 Mar 1704 Anjengo - 31 Mar Calicut - 10 Apr Tellicherry - 16 Apr Karwar - 29 Apr Mangalore - 14 May Bombay - 11 Dec Surat - 4 Mar 1705 Bombay - voyage ended 31 May 1707. (2) 1707/8 Surat. Capt John Lesley. Downs 14 Apr 1708 - 3 Sep Cape - 9 Jan 1709 Anjengo - 20 Jan Calicut - 6 Feb Mangalore - 11 Feb Karwar - 9 Mar Bombay - 10 Apr Surat - 7 May Bombay - 19 Jun Madras - 10 Jul Balasore - 24 Jul Calcutta - 16 Oct Rogues River - 6 Jan 1710 Bombay - 17 Jan Surat - 2 Apr Bombay - 30 May Madras - 27 Sep Cape - 25 Oct St Helena - voyage ended 21 May. (3) 1711/2 St Helena and Benkulen. Capt John Lesley. Downs 20 Jun 1712 - 3 Nov St Helena - 21 Feb 1713 Batavia - 20 Mar Benkulen - 27 Mar Silebar - 1 May Benkulen - 28 Sep Batavia - 12 Feb 1714 Cape - 1 Mar St Helena - 6 Jun Nore.
Voyages: (1) 1794/5 Bengal. Capt Robert Hogg. Liverpool 24 Aug 1795 - 11 Feb 1796 Bengal - 25 Mar Hugli - 4 Apr Culpee - 24 Jul St Helena - 26 Nov Crookhaven - 15 Dec Blackwall.

470/490 tons, 30/34 guns, 94/98 crew. Voyages: (1) 1717/8 Bombay. Capt Zachary Hicks. Downs 8 Mar 1718 - 2 Apr São Tiago - 19 Jul Johanna - 7 Sep Bombay - 5 Nov Khanderi - 9 Nov Colaba - 2 Dec Karwar - 24 Dec Goa - 29 Dec Vijayadura - 13 Jan 1719 Bombay - 30 Jan Surat - 9 Feb Bombay - 21 Feb Tellicherry - 3 Mar Calicut - 1 May Cochin - 23 Jul Réunion - 12 Oct Cape - 29 Nov St Helena - 24 Mar Nore. 5 Nov 1718-13 Jan 1719 expedition against Angria. (2) 1720/1 Bombay and Bengal. Capt Leonard Hicks. Downs 5 Nov 1720 - wrecked at the Cape Jun 1722.

Built by Temple at South Shields, measured 1802, 2 decks, length 122ft 2in, keel 98ft 4in, breadth 32ft, hold 14ft 11in, wing transom 17ft, port cell 25ft 8in, waist 10in, between decks 6ft 10in, roundhouse 6ft 4in, ports 6 middle, 60 crew, 558 tons. Principal Managing Owner: Moses Agar. Voyages: (1) 1801/2 Madras. Capt John Rogers. Downs 20 May 1802 - 25 Sep Madras - 3 Jan 1803 St Helena - 31 Mar Deptford. (2) 1802/3 Ceylon, Madras and Bengal. Portsmouth 28 Aug 1803 - captured by the French near Mauritius 9 Jan 1804.

Extra ship, built by Butler, measured 1786, 3 decks, 3in bottom, length 119ft, keel 94ft 10in, breadth 32ft 4in, hold 13ft 9¾in, wing transom 19ft 2in, port cell 22ft 9in, between decks 4ft 7½in & 5ft 4½in, ports 12 middle & upper, deck range 76ft, 18 guns, 84 crew, 527 tons. Principal Managing Owner: Godfrey Thornton. Voyages: (1) 1786/7 China. Capt Charles Lindegreen. Portsmouth 21 Feb 1787 - 11 May False Bay - 21 Aug Whampoa - 7 Jan 1788 Macao - 22 Apr St Helena - 1 Aug Deptford.
Voyages: (1) From China 1812. Capt Edward Lindsey. Lintin 5 Jul 1812 - 21 Aug Macao - 31 Dec Cape - 27 Jan 1813 St Helena - 18 May Blackwall.

Built by Hill, launched 1797, 3 decks, 4in bottom, length 145ft 8in, keel 118ft 3½in, breadth 36ft 2½in, hold 14ft 10in, wing transom 24ft, port cell 26ft 10in, waist 3ft 8in, between decks 6ft 3in & 6ft 6in, roundhouse 6ft 6in, ports 12 middle & 11 upper, deck range 82ft 6in, 816 tons. Principal Managing Owner: John Woolmore. Voyages: (1) 1796/7 Bengal and Benkulen. Capt Edward Bradford. Torbay 22 Sep 1797 - 16 Feb 1798 Kedgeree - 27 Jun Benkulen - 11 Aug Kedgeree - 24 Sep Saugor - 5 Nov Benkulen - 27 Mar 1799 St Helena - 24 Apr returned to St Helena - 4 Aug Blackwall. (2) 1800/1 Madras and China. Capt Edward Bradford. Portsmouth 31 Mar 1801 - 26 Jul Madras - 28 Aug Penang - 6 Oct Whampoa - 12 Apr 1802 St Helena - 12 Jul Blackwall. (3) 1802/3 Madras and Bengal. Capt Edward Bradford. Downs 1 Feb 1803 - 12 Feb Madeira - 23 Apr Cape - 13 Jun Madras - 22 Jul Diamond Harbour - 7 Nov Saugor - 12 Mar 1804 St Helena - 11 Jun Blackwall. (4) 1804/5 St Helena and Madras. Capt George Saltwell. Portsmouth 25 Apr 1805 - 4 Dec Madras - 21 Feb 1806 Colombo - 14 May St Helena - 1 Aug Blackwall. 27 Nov 1805 ten crew injured in skirmish with French ship. (5) 1806/7 Madras and Bengal. Capt William John Eastfield. Portsmouth 26 Feb 1807 - 3 Jul Madras - 21 Jul Kedgeree - 26 Jul Diamond Harbour - 16 Sep Saugor - 22 Oct Madras - 30 Dec Cape - 25 Jan 1808 St Helena - 28 Apr Blackwall. (6) 1808/9 Madras and Bengal. Capt William John Eastfield. Downs 24 Jan 1809 - lost on Goodwin Sands off South Foreland 25 Jan.

Built by Wells, launched 1762, 3 decks, 3in bottom, keel 110ft 6in, breadth 33ft 8in, 26 guns, 123/138 crew, 666 tons. Principal Managing Owner: John Durand. Voyages: (1) 1761/2 Bombay, Philippines and China. Capt Thomas Riddell. Portsmouth 6 May 1762 - 16 Sep Moheli - 11 Dec Bombay - 27 Jan 1763 Surat - 1 Mar Bombay - 30 Apr Surat - 11 May Bombay - 26 Jul Madras - 17 Sep Malacca - 17 Oct Cavite - 28 Nov Manila - 16 Jan 1764 Pangasinan - 30 Jan Manila - 26 May Sulu - 19 Nov Da-nang 2 Jun 1765 - 21 Jun Whampoa 14 Dec - 23 Mar 1766 St Helena - 25 Jun Deptford. (2) 1766/7 Bengal. Capt Thomas Riddell. Downs 8 Apr 1767 - 13 Jun Rio de Janeiro - 4 Sep Johanna - 11 Nov Bengal - 27 Feb 1768 Kedgeree 7 Apr - 31 Jul St Helena - 12 Nov Deptford. (3) 1769/70 Bombay. Capt Thomas Riddell. Downs 14 Mar 1770 - 8 Jul Johanna - 2 Aug Bombay - 18 Dec Tellicherry - 28 Dec Anjengo - 6 Mar 1771 Cape - 30 Mar St Helena - 27 Jul Deptford.

Built by Hudson & Bacon at Calcutta 1798, 511 tons. Sold in England for a store ship. Voyages: (1) From Bengal 1799. Capt William Lay. Calcutta 28 Dec 1799 - 15 Jun 1800 St Helena - 2 Sep Falmouth - 5 Oct Deptford. (2) From Bengal 1803. Calcutta 1 Jan 1803 - 1 Feb Kedgeree - 16 Jul St Helena - 27 Sep Gravesend.
Voyages: (1) From Bengal 1765. Capt John Griffin. Bengal 3 Jul 1765 - 28 Sep Kedgeree - 6 Oct Ingeli - 30 Dec Cape - 23 Jan 1766 St Helena - 10 Feb Ascension - 31 Mar Belem - 18 May Deptford.

Rated at 499 tons, 30 guns, 99/105 crew. Voyages: (1) 1740/1 Madras. Capt Benjamin Webster. Downs 1 May 1741 - 14 Aug Cape - 23 Dec Madras - 24 Dec 1742 Cape - 1 Aug 1743 Scarborough - 8 Aug Erith. (2) 1744/5 Madras. Capt Benjamin Webster. Downs 15 Feb 1745 - 27 Apr Madeira - 14 Aug Cape - 12 Dec Madras - 18 Jan 1746 Fort St David - 5 May St Helena - 1 Sep Downs. (3) 1747/8 Madras and China. Capt Edmund Cooke. Downs 5 Oct 1747 - 12 Dec Madeira - 16 Jan 1748 São Tiago - 28 Mar Cape - 24 Jun Mauritius - 28 Jul Fort St David - 23 Oct Benkulen - 1 Dec Batavia - 15 Jun 1749 Whampoa - 11 Feb 1750 St Helena - 3 Jun Deptford. (4) 1751/2 Madras and Bengal. Capt Edmund Cooke. Downs 17 Jan 1752 - 26 May Johanna - 5 Jul Fort St David - 1 Aug Vizagapatam - 22 Aug Culpee - 3 Oct Calcutta - 15 Jan 1753 Hugli - 8 Feb Madras - 1 Jun St Helena - 2 Sep Deptford.

Company's own ship, built by Woolcombe, launched 1758, 3 decks, 3in bottom, keel 90ft, breadth 40ft, 430 tons. Voyages: (1) 1757/8 Persia and Bombay. Capt William Cooke. Downs 21 Apr 1758 - 17 Nov Bandar Abbas - 23 Jan 1759 Bombay - 30 Jul St Helena - 22 Oct Deptford. (2) 1759/60 Bengal. Capt Francis Fowler. Downs 18 Mar 1760 - Bengal - 'towards England' 3 Dec 1762 - 16 Feb 1763 St Helena - 7 May Limehouse. (3) 1763/4 Benkulen, Madras and Bengal. Capt John Blewitt. Portsmouth 20 Feb 1764 - 4 Jul Benkulen - 12 Sep Batavia - 15 Nov Malacca - 4 Jan 1765 Madras - 21 Jan Fort St David - 12 Feb Madras - 18 Apr Benkulen - 19 Aug Moco Moco - 2 Oct Madras - 20 Dec Calcutta - 23 Mar 1766 Kedgeree - 18 May Acheh - 5 Sep St Helena - 21 Nov Plymouth - 28 Dec Limehouse. (4) 1766/7 Bengal, to remain. Capt John Griffin. Downs 8 Jun 1767 - Plymouth 23 Nov.
Frigate, 230 tons. Owner Thomas Lucas. Voyages: (1) 1670/1 Bantam, Cambodia and Taiwan. Capt Roger Bennett. Downs Jan 1671 - 3 Jan 1673 Downs.

Bought in 1614, former name Judith, 350 tons. Voyages: (1) 1614/5 Bantam and Japan. Master John Totten/Richard Wickham. Downs Dec 1614 - Cape 18 May 1615 - 24 Jul Bantam 12 Aug - Pattani - Bantam Jun 1616 - 12 Jul Hirado 1 Feb 1617 - Bantam - 2 Aug Hirado 20 Feb 1618 - abandoned at Masulipatam Sep 1619.

350/375 tons, 25/30 guns, 75 crew. Voyages: (1) 1636/7 Coromandel. Downs - 12 Aug 1637 Masulipatam - 7 Jan 1639 Plymouth. (2) 1639/40 Bantam, Persia and Coromandel. Downs - Bantam Dec 1640 - Bandar Abbas - Masulipatam - 24 Sep 1641 Madras - 3 Dec Masulipatam - 21 Dec Madras - 9 Feb 1642 Bandar Abbas - voyages between Bantam and Coromandel 1642-1647 - returned home 1648/9 ? (3) 1649/50 Bantam. Capt John Arnold. Downs 23 Feb 1650 -. (4) 1657/8 Bantam. Capt Robert May. Downs May 1658 - Bantam - Mauritius - Jan 1660 Downs.
Pinnace, former name Canary Bird, 100/150 tons. Voyages: (1) 1673/4 Madras and Bengal. Capt William Gaich. Plymouth Feb 1674 -.
Frigate, 130 tons, 12 guns, 26 crew. Voyages: (1) 1700/1 Madras. Capt William Redhead. Downs 7 Jul 1700 -.

240 tons. Voyages: (1) 1660/1 St Helena and Bantam. Downs 26 Jan 1661 - St Helena 6 May - 29 Jul Bantam - May 1662 Downs. (2) 1662/3 Capt Robert Fisher. Downs Mar 1663 - 10 Jul 1664 Downs. (3) 1664/5 Surat. Capt Thomas Harman. Downs 23 Mar 1665 - 3 Sep Surat 10 Sep 1666 - Mar 1667 Downs.

Built by Barnard, launched 1787, 3 decks, 4in bottom, length 143ft 8in, keel 116ft, breadth 36ft 3½in, hold 14ft 11in, wing transom 23ft 4in, port cell 26ft 5in, waist 1ft 2½in, between decks 6ft & 6ft 3in, roundhouse 6ft 3in, ports 13 middle & upper, deck range 80ft 9in, 813 tons. 380/400 tons, 26 guns, 76/80 crew. Voyages: (1) 1720/1 Mokha. Capt Henry Wilson. Falmouth 5 Jan 1721 - 22 Apr 1722. (2) 1723/4 Bengal. Capt Henry Wilson. Downs 15 Feb 1724 - 26 May Cape - 31 Jul Fort St David - 5 Aug Madras - 25 Aug Rogues River - 20 Sep Calcutta - 10 Dec Madras - 5 Jan 1725 Fort St David - 7 Apr St Helena - 5 Jul Woolwich. ff.6-7 sailing directions for the convoy leaving England. (3) 1727/8 Madras and Bengal. Capt William Birch. 21 Jan 1728 - 27 Aug 1729. (4) 1730/1 Madras and Bengal. Capt William Birch. Downs 16 Mar 1731 - 26 Jul Madras - 21 Aug Calcutta - 24 Oct Rogues River - 3 Dec Balasore - Rogues River 17 Dec 1732 - 25 Dec Madras - 20 Mar 1733 Cape - 28 May Barbados - 27 Jul Downs.

Built by Perry, launched 1759, 3 decks, 3in bottom, keel 107ft 3in, breadth 33ft 10in, 26 guns, 106 crew, 655 tons. Voyages: (1) 1758/9 Madras and Bengal. Capt George Lindsay. Downs 30 Mar 1759 - 1 May Madeira - 10 Aug St Augustine's Bay - 28 Oct Madras - 25 Dec Balasore - 1 Jan 1760 Culpee - Ingeli 16 Mar - 24 Apr Moco Moco - 30 May Madras 18 Aug - 28 Nov St Helena - captured by the French 6 Mar 1761 off Scilly.

330 tons, 30 guns, 66 crew. Voyages: (1) 1704/5 Bombay. Capt William Beawes. Downs 31 Jan 1705 - Bombay 3 Oct 1707 - 29 Jan 1708 Cape - 19 Mar St Helena - 1 Aug Rio de Janeiro - wrecked 9 Dec 1708 Polperro, Cornwall.

Built by West, launched 1762, 3 decks, 3in bottom, keel 116ft, breadth 33ft, 26 guns, 99 crew, 668 tons. Principal Managing Owner: John Hyde. Voyages: (1) 1761/2 China. Capt William Larkins. Downs 25 Apr 1762 - Portsmouth 6 May - 19 Oct Whampoa - 24 Jan 1763 Second Bar - 15 Feb Manila - 20 Mar Malacca - 7 Jul St Helena - 27 Sep Woolwich. (2) 1764/5 Madras and China. Capt William Larkins. Wrecked outward-bound 15 Jan 1765 off the North Foreland.

Built by Perry, launched 1787, 3 decks, 4in bottom, length 153ft 11in, keel 125ft, breadth 38ft, hold 15th 7in, wing transom 23ft 8in, port cell 27ft 3in, waist 1ft 1in, between decks 6ft 4in, roundhouse 6ft 4in, ports 14 middle & upper, deck range 87ft 10in, 116/140 crew, 961 tons. Portsmouth 18 Jun 1799 - 14 Aug Rio de Janeiro - 25 Nov Tellicherry - 6 Dec Bombay - 2 Feb 1800 Anjengo - 5 Feb Quilon - 15 Feb Anjengo - 15 May St Helena - 6 Aug Long Reach. (7) 1804/5 Madras, Bengal and China. Capt Benjamin Richardson. Portsmouth 27 Sep 1805 - 21 Oct São Tiago - 11 Feb 1806 Madras - 13 Mar Masulipatam - 23 Mar Kedgeree - 6 May Saugor - 12 Jun Penang - 26 Jul Saugor - 22 Nov Penang - 7 Feb 1807 Whampoa - 13 Mar Second Bar - 3 May Lintin - 1 Jul Penang - 19 Sep Cape - 13 Oct St Helena - 2 Jan 1808 Long Reach. Extra ship, repaired by Perry, measured 1797, 3 decks, 3in bottom, length 109ft 4in, keel 86ft 9½in, breadth 30ft 6½in, hold 12ft 11in, wing transom 16ft 10in, waist 3in, between decks 5ft 2in & 5ft 6in, ports 8 upper, 45 crew, 430 tons. Chartered ship, 35/44 crew, 470 tons. Principal Managing Owners: 1 Samuel Granger, 2 Charles Weller. Voyages: (1) 1820/1 Madras and Bengal. Capt Charles Weller. Chartered ship, 350 tons. Managing Owners: John Millet. Voyages: (1) 1641/2 Surat. Capt John Millet. Extra ship, measured 1786, 2 decks, 3in bottom, length 111ft 6in, keel 88ft 5½in, breadth 30ft 9in, hold 13ft 9in, wing transom 18ft 5in, between decks 6ft 9in, 444 tons. Voyages: (1) 1788/9 Guinea. Capt Richards. From England Mar 1789 - Cape Coast Castle - Accra - Ouidah - captured by the French 9/10 Aug 1789.

Voyages: (1) 1796/7 Bengal. Capt William Wallace. Portsmouth 12 Aug 1796 - 23 Jan 1797 Saugor - 29 Jan Calcutta - Culpee 27 Mar - 12 Jul Cape - 11 Sep St Helena - 18 Dec Long Reach. This ship appears to have been known initially as the Arabia Factor, and is referred to as such in an IOR ship ledger (IOR/L/MAR/A/CLXX), in entries dated 1701-1703. However, later references, both in the same volume and elsewhere, refer to the ship as the Arabia Merchant (see IOR/L/MAR/B/752A, as well as IOR/E/3/94 and IOR/E/3/95). It is unclear whether it was formally renamed Arabia Merchant, or whether both names were used interchangeably. Since it is the later references that use the name Arabia Merchant, this authority file record has been given that name, with Arabia Factor included as its other name. 160 tons, 14 guns, 32 crew. Voyages: (1) 1701/2 Mokha. Capt Abraham Jackson. 19 Nov 1701 - 23 Oct 1703. (2) 1704/5 Mokha, Bombay and Calicut. Capt Abraham Jackson. Downs 12 Dec 1704 - 28 Jun 1705 Mokha - 19 Oct Bombay - 19 Nov Gogha - 31 Dec Bombay - 23 Jan 1706 Calicut - 24 Mar Bombay - 30 Apr Surat - 5 May Bombay - 20 May Karwar - 20 Oct Bombay - 5 Jan 1707 Karwar - 27 Jan Tellicherry - 3 Feb Calicut - 24 Apr Mauritius - 11 Sep 1708 Downs.

Former names: Mare Scourge and Scourge of Malice. Built 1619, 280 tons. Voyages: (1) 1619/20 Surat. Master Thomas Taylor. Downs Mar 1620 - Nov Surat - Bandar Abbas - Surat - Jambi - Batavia 6 Mar 1622 - Downs. (2) 1623/4 Surat and Bantam. Rated at 350/527 tons. Voyages: (1) 1610/1 Bantam. Capt Anthony Hippon. Steam sloop, built at Northfleet. Arrived Bombay 19 April 1840. Lieut John Park Sanders IN. Voyages from Bombay to Karachi, Aden and Suez 1840-1847, chiefly with mails. Lieuts Frederick Parry Webb IN, John Bird IN, Henry Carne Boulderson IN, Edward Webb Stone Daniell IN, Benjamin Hamilton IN. Lost in hurricane off Malabar Coast and Laccadives April 1847 en route from Bombay to Singapore with 100 convicts. Commander J A Young IN.
Steam War Ship/Steam Packet Vessel. Arrived Calcutta March 1840. Walter Warden. Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Aden and Suez. Lieut John Glen Johnston IN, Capt Thomas Grere Carless IN.
Steam Iron Pilot Brig.  Arrived Calcutta March 1845.  John William Lewis.
Steam Frigate.  Arrived Bombay February 1847.  Comrs Richard Ethersey IN, Harry H Hewett IN.  Operated from Bombay chiefly to Aden and Suez

Steam Frigate. Arrived Hong Kong September 1842. Capt John Pepper IN, Comr. Richard Ethersey IN. Operated from Bombay chiefly to Aden and Suez. Comr Richard Ethersey IN, Lieuts John William Young IN, Benjamin Hamilton IN, Allen Edward Ball IN

Steam frigate. Arrived Bombay late 1840. Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Persian Gulf but also to Sinagpore and Aden. Capt Robert Moresby IN, Lieuts James Rennie IN, James Anthony Young IN, John James Frushard IN, Benjamin Hamilton IN, Comr Thomas Grere Carless IN, Capt William Lowe IN.

Steam sloop. Built at Bombay 1829. Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Aden, Suez and Persian Gulf. Lieuts Philip Powell IN, Frederick Parry Webb IN, Charles Dugald Campbell IN, John James Frushard IN, Harry H Hewett IN. Sold 1859.
River Steamer.  J Digney.

Steam sloop. Arrived Bombay April 1837. John P Campbell. Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Aden, Suez and Persian Gulf. Lieuts Frederick Parry Webb IN, Robert Lowe IN, Charles Harrison Berthon IN, F W Hopkins IN, John William Young IN, Alexander Henry Gordon IN, and others.
Steam frigate, formerly KILKENNY. Arrived Bombay July 1839. G R Fox. Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Aden and Suez. Lieuts Henry A Ormsby IN, Alexander Henry Gordon IN, Alfred Newman. Hulked 1850.
Steam frigate, formerly KILKENNY. Arrived Bombay July 1839. G R Fox. Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Aden and Suez. Lieuts Henry A Ormsby IN, Alexander Henry Gordon IN, Alfred Newman. Hulked 1850.
Steamer.  Arrived China Sea 1840.  William Hutcheons Hall.  Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Karachi.  A William Oliver, R S Ross.

Steam sloop. Built at Bombay 1839. Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Aden and Suez. Lieuts George Borlase Kempthorne IN, John Shaw Grieve IN, Andrew Nisbett IN, William Charles Barker IN, Frederick Erskine Manners IN, George Norris Adams IN.

Steam sloop. Built at Bombay 1840. Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Aden and Suez, also to Singapore and China. Comr William Lowe IN, Lieuts Harry H Hewett IN, Richard Ethersey IN, Comr Henry Blosse Lynch IN, Lieut Allen Edward Hall IN, Comrs Henry Alexander Ormsby IN, Henry CArne Boulderson IN, Lieuts Benjamin Brangwin IN, John William Young IN .

Steamer.  Arrived Bombay Apr 1838.  Capt George Barnes Brucks IN.  Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Persian Gulf and Indus River, with an abortive mail voyage towards Suez.  Lieut John Patterson Porter IN.  Subsequently renamed Charger and converted to a block ship and coal depot at Aden.

Steamer.  Arrived Bombay Apr 1838.  Capt George Barnes Brucks IN.  Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Persian Gulf and Indus River, with an abortive mail voyage towards Suez.  Lieut John Patterson Porter IN.  Subsequently renamed Charger and converted to a block ship and coal depot at Aden.

Steam frigate. Built at Bombay 1842. Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Aden and Suez. Lieut Charles Harrison Berthon IN, Comr John Park Sanders IN ,Lieuts Edward Webb Stone Daniell IN, Benjamin Hamilton IN, John James Frushard IN. Hulked 1863.

Steam sloop. Arrived Bombay June 1837. Capt George Grant, Indian Navy. Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Karachi, Muscat, Aden and Suez. Comr William Lowe, Indian Navy, Lieuts James Anthony Young, Indian Navy, William Charles Barker, Indian Navy, John Glen Johnston, Indian Navy. It sunk in 1865.
Steam frigate. Arrived Singapore Jun 1842. Comr. Thomas Frederick Powell IN. Operated from Bombay.

Steam frigate.  Arrived Bombay Dec 1847.  Comr John Park Sander IN.  Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Aden and Suez.  Comr. Alexander Henry Gordon, Lieuts Charles Dugald Campbell IN, Henry William Grounds IN, James Rennie IN, William Charles Barker IN.
Steam transport. Arrived Madras Dec 1856. Comr Charles Dugald Campbell.
Steam frigate. Built at Bombay 1854. Operated from Bombay, to Aden

Steam packet vessel. Built at Bombay 1848. Operated from Bombay, chiefly to Aden and Suez. Comr. John James Frushard IN, Lieut Alan Hyde Gardner IN, Comrs James Rennie IN, Henry Albert Matthew Drought IN, Lieut William Balfour IN. Also called Feerooz

Steam sloop.  Built at Bombay 1840.  Lieut Harry H Hewett IN.
Dutch East India Company ship, lost 24 July 1779.
